title: Steele dossier
added: Associated Press details the December 2019 Horowitz Report mentioning an inaccuracy in the dossier regarding Michael Cohen, which may have been the Prague allegation.<ref>https://apnews.com/article/donald-trump-politics-russia-trump-investigations-latin-america-d6960fe493d0eb65791778f2f5a4c131</ref> ''Rolling Stone'' describes that the Horowitz Report describes the dossier's Cohen-Prague allegation as either fake or baseless.<ref>https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-features/horowitz-report-russia-investigation-questions-remaining-928081/</ref> CNN interpreted the Horowitz Report as saying that the dossier's Cohen-Prague allegation was untrue.<ref>https://edition.cnn.com/2019/12/09/politics/fbi-steele-dossier/index.html</ref>

title: Steele dossier
added: ==== Against Oath Inc. (Verizon Media). Filed by Carter Page ====

Page's suit targeted Oath for 11 articles, especially one written by Michael Isikoff and published by Yahoo! in September 2016. The judge dismissed the suit on February 14, 2021, noting that "Page's arguments regarding Isikoff's description of the dossier and Steele were 'either sophistry or political spin'." He also said that Page "failed to allege actual malice by any of the authors, and that the three articles written by HuffPost employees were true".<ref name="Chase_2/14/2021">{{cite web | last=Chase | first=Randall | date=February 14, 2021 | title=Judge tosses Page defamation suit against Verizon company | agency=[[Associated Press]] | url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/judge-tosses-page-defamation-suit-verizon-company-75894421 | access-date=September 14, 2021 }}</ref>

title: Steele dossier
added: The dossier has been described as a "case study" in [[Media manipulation]] <ref>{{cite news |date=July 14, 2021 |first=T.A. |last=Frank |title=The Steele Dossier Was a Case Study in How Reporters Get Manipulated' |website=[[nymag.com]] |url=https://nymag.com/intelligencer/amp/2021/07/steele-dossier-was-case-study-in-journalistic-manipulation | access-date=October 3, 2021}}

title: Steele dossier
added: On February 11, 2021, Page lost a defamation suit he had filed against [[Yahoo! News]] and ''[[HuffPost]]'' for their articles which described his activities mentioned in the Steele dossier. The judge said that Page admitted the articles about his potential contacts with Russian officials were essentially true.<ref>Multiple sources:

* {{cite web | last=Leonard | first=Mike | date=February 11, 2021 | title=Carter Page Loses Libel Case Over 'Steele Dossier,' Russia Probe | publisher=[[Bloomberg Law]] | url=https://news.bloomberglaw.com/us-law-week/carter-page-loses-libel-case-over-steele-dossier-russia-probe | access-date=February 13, 2021 }}

* {{cite web | last=Leonard | first=Mike | date=March 16, 2021 | title=Carter Page Seeks to Revive Defamation Case Over His Russia Ties | publisher=[[Bloomberg Law]] | url=https://news.bloomberglaw.com/us-law-week/carter-page-seeks-to-revive-defamation-case-over-his-russia-ties | access-date=March 17, 2021 }}

* {{cite web | last=Montgomery | first=Jeff | date=February 11, 2021 | title=Del. Judge Nixes Carter Page Yahoo, HuffPost Defamation Suit | publisher=[[Law360]] | url=https://www.law360.com/corporate/articles/1354820/del-judge-nixes-carter-page-yahoo-huffpost-defamation-suit | access-date=February 13, 2021 }}</ref>

title: Steele dossier
added: Following the dossier's release, Steele completely avoided on-camera interviews until he participated in an ABC News documentary that was released on October 18, 2021. In that documentary, Steele maintained that his sources were credible and that it was typical in intelligence investigations to "never get to the point where you're 99% certain of the evidence to secure a conviction." Steele also acknowledged that one of his sources had faced repercussions; he confirmed that the source was still alive, but he would not provide further details.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Pellish|first=Aaron|last2=Herb|first2=Jeremy|date=18 October 2021|title=Ex-intel official who created controversial Trump Russia dossier speaks out|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/17/politics/christopher-steele-dossier-trump/index.html|url-status=live|access-date=2021-10-18|website=CNN}}</ref>
